"Fury" is a military drama film directed by Brad Pitt. The movie tells the story of Captain Bill Hicks (played by Brad Pitt)) and his crew on board USS Apache (CA-67) ) in the Vietnam War. The movie also stars Robert Petreson,Logan Lerman, and Jennifer Aniston.

"Bloody Sunday" is a British television drama series based on the book "The Boys from Bilson Street" by Michael Morpurgo. The series was first broadcast on 4 January 2015 at 18:30 hours BST. The series stars David Ashton, Richard Hope, and Christopher Landon.

"Cold Mountain" is a 2003 American epic war film directed by James Mangold, based on the novel of the same name by John Steinbeck. The film stars Christian Bale as John Smith, a Union soldier who after being shot in the leg he decides to walk back home to Cold Mountain, North Carolina to reunite with his sweetheart. The film also stars Michael Caine as Thomas Edison, a Confederate soldier who after being shot in the head he decides to walk back home to Cold Mountain, North Carolina to reunite with his sweetheart. The film also stars Ben Kingsley as General John Smith of Virginia, United States, the historical figure that this film is based on.
